008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.mser.components;
010
011import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
012import java.io.PrintStream;
013import java.util.Collection;
014import java.util.HashSet;
015import java.util.Iterator;
016import java.util.LinkedList;
017import java.util.Set;
018
019import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
020import imagingbook.common.mser.MserData;
021import imagingbook.common.mser.components.PixelMap.Pixel;
022
023/**
024 * Abstract class representing a tree of extremal image components.
025 * 
026 * @param <T> the data type of components (e.g., {@link MserData})
027 * @author WB
028 * @version 2022/11/19
029 */
030public abstract class ComponentTree<T> implements Iterable<Component<T>> {
031        
032        /**
033         * Enumeration specifying the method (algorithm) for building the component tree.
034         */
035        public enum Method {
036                /** Specifies the classic (global immersion) algorithm, see {@link ComponentTreeGlobalImmersion}. */
037                GlobalImmersion,
038                /** Specifies the linear-time algorithm, see {@link ComponentTreeLinearTime}. */
039                LinearTime;
040        }
041        
042        // --------------------------------------------------------------
043        
044        ComponentTree() {               // non-public constructor
045        }
046        
047        /**
048         * Creates a new component tree for the specified image using the default method
049         * ({@link Method#LinearTime}).
050         * 
051         * @param <T> the generic node type
052         * @param ip  the input image
053         * @return the component tree for the specified image
054         */
055        public static <T> ComponentTree<T> from(ByteProcessor ip) {
056                return from(ip, Method.LinearTime);
057        }
058        
059        /**
060         * Creates a new component tree for the specified image.
061         * 
062         * @param <T>    the data type of components (e.g., {@link MserData})
063         * @param ip     the input (gray-level) image
064         * @param method the method for building the component tree
065         * @return the component tree
066         */
067        public static <T> ComponentTree<T> from(ByteProcessor ip, Method method) {
068                return from(new PixelMap(ip), method);
069        }
070        
071        /**
072         * Creates a new component tree for the specified {@link PixelMap}.
073         * 
074         * @param <T>    the data type of components (e.g., {@link MserData})
075         * @param pm     a {@link PixelMap} instance
076         * @param method the method for building the component tree
077         * @return the component tree
078         */
079        public static <T> ComponentTree<T> from(PixelMap pm, Method method) {
080                switch (method) {
081                case LinearTime:  return new ComponentTreeLinearTime<>(pm);
082                case GlobalImmersion: return new ComponentTreeGlobalImmersion<>(pm);
083                }
084                return null;
085        }
086        
087        // --------------------------------------------------------------
088
089        /**
090         * Returns the root component of this component tree.
091         * 
092         * @return the root component
093         */
094        public abstract Component<T> getRoot();
095
096        /**
097         * Returns an unordered collection of all tree components.
098         * 
099         * @return all tree components
100         */
101        public abstract Collection<Component<T>> getComponents();
102        
103        @Override
104        public Iterator<Component<T>> iterator() {
105                return getComponents().iterator();
106        }
107        
108        /**
109         * Finds and returns a collection of all leaf components of this tree. A leaf is
110         * a component which has no children.
111         * 
112         * @return all leaf components
113         */
114        public Collection<Component<T>> getLeaves() {
115                Collection<Component<T>> leaves = new LinkedList<>();
116                for (Component<T> c : getComponents()) {
117                        if (c.getChildren().isEmpty()) {
118                                leaves.add(c);
119                        }
120                }       
121                return leaves;
122        }
123        
124        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
125        
126        /**
127         * Performs integrity checks on this component tree.
128         * 
129         * @return true iff all checks are passed
130         */
131        public boolean validate() {
132                if (!checkNodes()) {
133                        System.out.println("checkNodes failed");
134                        return false;
135                }
136                if (!checkParents()) {
137                        System.out.println("checkParents failed");
138                        return false;
139                }
140                if (!checkChildren()) {
141                        System.out.println("checkChildren failed");
142                        return false;
143                }
144                if (!checkRoot()) {
145                        System.out.println("checkRoot failed");
146                        return false;
147                }
148                if (!checkLevels()) {
149                        System.out.println("checkLevels failed");
150                        return false;
151                }
152                if (!checkSize()) {
153                        System.out.println("checkSize failed");
154                        return false;
155                }
156                return true;
157        }
158        
159        /**
160         * Checks if all tree nodes reachable through root are contained in components
161         * list and the tree has no duplicate nodes (and no cycles).
162         * 
163         * @return true iff OK
164         */
165        boolean checkNodes() {
166                Set<Component<T>> componentSet = new HashSet<>(); // empty hash set
167                int duplicateID = traverse(getRoot(), componentSet);
168                if (duplicateID >= 0) {         // traverse() registers all visited components
169                        System.out.println("*** component tree has duplicate node: " + duplicateID);
170                        return false;
171                }
172                if (getComponents().size() != componentSet.size()) {
173                        System.out.println("*** some nodes in components list can not be reached!");
174                        return false;
175                }
176                return true;
177        }
178        
179        int traverse(Component<T> c, Set<Component<T>> cS) {
180                if (cS.add(c)) {
181                        for (Component<T> cc : c.getChildren()) {
182                                int duplicateId = traverse(cc, cS);
183                                if (duplicateId >= 0) { // duplicate node
184                                        return duplicateId;
185                                };
186                        }
187                        return -1;      // everything OK, no duplicate node
188                }
189                else {  // c was already in set
190                        System.out.println("*** duplicate tree node: " + c.ID);
191                        return c.ID;
192                }
193        }
194
195        /**
196         * Checks if all parent relations are consistent.
197         * 
198         * @return true iff OK
199         */
200        boolean checkParents() {
201                Collection<Component<T>> comps = getComponents();
202                HashSet<Component<T>> compsH = new HashSet<>(comps); // to improve lookup speed
203                
204                for (Component<?> c : comps) {
205                        Component<?> p = c.getParent();
206                        if (p == null) {
207                                continue;
208                        }
209                        
210                        // check if parent is listed in 'components' (use HashSet for speed)
211                        if (!compsH.contains(p)) {
212                                System.out.println("*** component not contained in components list: " + c.ID);
213                                return false;
214                        }
215                                                
216                        // check if parent is not c itself
217                        if (p == c) {
218                                System.out.println("*** self-referring parent link in component " + c.ID);
219                                return false;
220                        }                               
221                }
222                return true;
223        }
224        
225        /**
226         * Checks if all child relations are consistent.
227         * 
228         * @return true iff OK
229         */
230        boolean checkChildren() {
231                for (Component<?> c : getComponents()) {
232                        // check if children is a list (not null)
233                        if (c.getChildren() == null) {
234                                System.out.println("*** children is null (not an empty list) in component " + c.ID);
235                                return false;
236                        }
237                        
238                        // check if all children of c have c as parent
239                        for (Component<?> child : c.getChildren()) {
240                                // check if c is parent of its child:
241                                if (child.getParent() != c) {
242                                        System.out.println("*** incorrect parent link in component " + child.ID);
243                                        return false;
244                                }
245                        }       
246                }
247                return true;
248        }
249        
250        /**
251         * Checks if the tree has a unique root.
252         * 
253         * @return true iff OK
254         */
255        boolean checkRoot() {
256                // check if a single root exists and is properly marked (with null parent)
257                int rootcnt = 0;
258                Component<T> root = getRoot();
259                for (Component<?> c : getComponents()) {
260                        if (c.getParent() == null) {
261                                rootcnt++;
262                                if (c != root) {
263                                        System.out.println("*** found non-root node without parent: " + c.ID);
264                                        return false;
265                                }
266                        }
267                }
268                if (rootcnt > 1) {
269                        System.out.println("*** found multiple roots: " + rootcnt);
270                        return false;
271                }
272                return true;
273        }
274        
275        /**
276         * Checks if all local pixels of have the same value as {@link #level}.
277         * 
278         * @return true iff OK
279         */
280        boolean checkLevels() {
281                for (Component<?> c : getComponents()) {
282                        int lc = c.getLevel();
283                        
284                        // check if parent's level is greater than this component's level:
285                        Component<?> p = c.getParent();
286                        if (p != null) {
287                                int lp = p.getLevel();
288                                if (lc >= lp) { // must be lc < lp
289                                        System.out.println("*** value lc >= lp for component " + c.ID);
290                                }
291                        }
292                        
293                        // check if all local points have the same level as this component's level:
294                        for (Pixel x : c.getLocalPixels()) {
295                                if (x.val != lc) {
296                                        System.out.println("*** local pixel with wrong value in component " + c.ID);
297                                        return false;
298                                }
299                        }
300                }
301                return true;
302        }
303        
304        /**
305         * Checks if the size of each component is the same as the number of local
306         * pixels plus the combined size of all children.
307         * 
308         * @return true iff OK
309         */
310        boolean checkSize() {
311                for (Component<?> c : getComponents()) {
312                        int csize = c.getLocalPixels().size();
313                        for (Component<?> cc : c.getChildren()) {
314                                csize = csize + cc.getSize();
315                        }
316                        if (csize != c.getSize()) {
317                                System.out.println("*** wrong size in component " + c.ID);
318                                return false;
319                        }
320                }
321                return true;
322        }
323        
324        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
325        
326        @Override
327        public String toString() { 
328                ByteArrayOutputStream os = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
329                PrintStream ps = new PrintStream(os);
330                this.printToStream(ps);
331                return os.toString();
332        }
333        
334        private void printToStream(PrintStream strm) {
335                strm.print(this.getClass().getSimpleName() + ": ");
336                strm.format("   number of components: %d\n", getComponents().size());
337                for (Component<?> r : getComponents()) {
338                        r.printToStream(strm);
339                        strm.println();
340                }
341                strm.println("root = " + getRoot());
342        }
343        
344        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
345        
346        private static int INDENT = 4;
347        
348        // print a forest with multiple roots
349        static String toStringRecursive(ComponentTree<?> rt) { 
350                ByteArrayOutputStream os = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
351                PrintStream ps = new PrintStream(os);
352                
353                for (Component<?> c : rt) {
354                        if (c.getParent() == null || c.getParent() == c) {      // start at any root
355                                printToStreamRecursive(c, ps, 0);
356                        }       
357                }       
358                return os.toString();
359        }
360        
361        // print tree with a single root
362        static String toStringRecursive(Component<?> rt) { 
363                ByteArrayOutputStream os = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
364                PrintStream ps = new PrintStream(os);
365                printToStreamRecursive(rt, ps, 0);      
366                return os.toString();
367        }
368        
369        
370        private static void printToStreamRecursive(Component<?> c, PrintStream ps, int indent) {
371                for (int i=0; i < indent; i++) {
372                        ps.append('|');
373                        for (int j = 0; j < INDENT; j++) {
374                                ps.append(' ');
375                        }
376                }
377                c.printToStream(ps);
378                ps.println();
379                for (Component<?> child : c.getChildren()) {
380                        printToStreamRecursive(child, ps, indent + 1);
381                }
382        }
383
384}
